p: Despite the genetic background that confers higher resistance to HPAIVs in chickens remains unknown, it was reported that the G/A polymorphism at position 2032 in chicken Mx gene (substitution of serine to asparagine at position 631 in the protein) conferred an antiviral effect against AIV infection in vitro [ 12]. However, several in vitro and in vivo experiments have failed to demonstrate a clear correlation between this polymorphism and inhibition of AIVs or survival after infection, respectively [ 6, 13â€“ 16]. Therefore, the role of Mx in AIVs infections in chickens is still under debate.
